article.title: House of Science Robotics
article.text: This robotics group has ben running since 2014 and we currently have three VRC robots with 3 people to each robot and 5 VEXIQ robotic teams with two people in each team. the VRC teams meet ever friday and saturday for 2 hours each day and the VEXIQ meet ever friday for 2 hours. During the year we run 2-3 holiday programs to raise funds for entering the teams.

article.title: We take misfits
article.text: At house of science we pride ourselves in taking in people from schools that don't have robotics teams. These kids are not supported by their schools in there search for robots domination however they are emotionally supported by their schools. These kids under the guidance of shane and paul are train to be the very best at making VEX robots.

article.title: William
article.text: William is a special child who is appart of VRC 8757C and likes Lego. He is from tauranga boys and he is a prominant member of the community with almost no criminal record.

article.title: Paul
article.text: Paul is our demonstator that demonstrates how to build VEX things. He has been here since the beginning of time(or the beginning of HOS robotics).

article.title: Hamish
article.text: Hamish is appart of a VEXIQ who specialises in Designing and building robots.

article.title: Orion
article.text: Orion is appart of VRC 8757B and is the programmer and secondary programmer. Orion tells me that he is a punching bag.

article.title: George
article.text: George is apart of VRC 8757A doing building and driving. He actually shows up to robotics.

article.title: Joe
article.text: Joe is appart of VRC 8757C specailizing in programming and design notebooking(does some building and doesn't shave bearing). Joe programmed the website and is the one who typed this.

article.title: Sam
article.text: Sam is apart of VRC 8757A and specializes in driving and can do some building. Says his name is Sam.

article.title: Sam Gille Smith
article.text: Sam is apart of VRC 8757A and does Programming, Driving and building. He has been here since the beginning of time(or the beginning of HOS robotics).

article.title: Shane
article.text: Shane provides example of how to code and he does VRU in his spare time.

article.title: Jacob
article.text: Jacob is the leader of VRC 8757C and does programming, design and driving. He has the greatest ideas

article.title: Gaby
article.text: Gaby is apart of VRC 8757B is an all rounder. Only female at HOS robotics.

article.title: HOS rules
article.text: HOS robotics rules state: You are not allowed to sing 'I play pokemon go' (also known as the 'forbidden song'), no wasting zip ties, not allowed to shoot any one with rubber band(with exception to fire a rubber band at people that sing 'I play pokemon go'), you do not have the rights to any chair once you stand up the chair is free for all, if you drop a controller you must do 100 pushups, puns are PUNishable by death and Jacob may never take of his shoes at House of Science.
